intro: Dianthus ucarii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill campion, is a flowering plant native to California and Nevada in the United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and woodland edges. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Dianthus ucarii is an herbaceous perennial that is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
